course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Politics of Protest
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 12Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as POLS 385 3)
This course is designed to analyze topics of political protest, resistance and activism on the national, state, and local levels. By reviewing movement action led by Black people, students will recognize the nature of protest, development of social movements, and political responsiveness to contention.
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: 6022, Section #: 12, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 8:30-9:45a, Instructor: G. Gray, Status: Open
